live_updates:
Thank you to everyone who has reached out for an update on services being restored in Hope BC. We understand how crucial our services are to you and your community and we are urgently working on getting services reconnected to your home and the rest of Hope. Currently, we are working with the Municipality of Hope BC, BC Hydro, and other safety teams to re-establish our services in your town. As soon as we have a definitive timeline, we will update you.
Shaw has credited customer’s accounts located in Hope BC for 30 days of billing for your peace of mind while your services are restored.
Shaw has also committed to donating $500,000 to support British Columbians and their communities, including support for Food Banks BC, the relief and recovery efforts of the Canadian Red Cross, as well as several local grassroots charitable organizations in affected areas through Shaw’s Brighter Communities program.
If you’d like to read more on what Shaw is doing to restore services and support your community, please visit this page.

Ongoing extreme weather and damage to road infrastructure is causing delays in shipping replacement equipment and tech home visits to Hope as well as causing issues in getting access to some areas to complete work. We will have more updates by end of day Wednesday and will continue work diligently to get customers back online as soon as possible. Thank you for your continued patience.
Tech crews continue to work in the area to restore services.  We will continue to monitor the situation and provide updates when available.
On-site technicians continue working diligently to resolve this outage.
BC Hydro does not have an ETA on repairs at the moment, and expect work to take most of the day. Once power has been restored, our crews will be on site to restore services.
Tech crews continue to work in the area to restore services.

Technicians and Hydro crews continue to work to restore service as quickly possible. However, due to the nature of the repairs involved, We are unable to provide an ETA Thank you for your patience! We will continue to monitor the situation and provide updates when available.
Due to the complexity of this outage, our technicians are still working to resolve it.
Technicians are on site working to restore service as quickly as possible. No ETA at this time but we will continue to monitor the situation and provide updates when available.

Our technicians continue to work to restore services where possible, while also awaiting restoration of hydro power to our equipment in certain areas. Further updates will be provided as they become available.
Work is still being done on-site, with no ETA at this time.

Our technicians continue to repair services. We apologize for the extended disruption.

We continue to await restoration of hydro power to be restored in the affected areas. Once hydro is restored our services will begin to come online.

43950.summary: Some customers in Hope are experiencing an interruption to Internet, Television and Home Phone services. We are working to restore service as quickly as possible and apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.
43950.title: Nov 14 - Hope | All Services - Outage (Fix in Progress)

live_updates: Services for much of the Fraser Valley have been restored, but some customers still remain offline in the Sumas Prairie and Hope regions.  Our technicians continue to work to restore services, as conditions allow, but due to the nature of repairs involved, there is no ETA at this time.  Thank you for your continued patience.
Tech crews continue to work in the area to restore services.  We will continue to monitor the situation and provide updates when available.

Teams remain working throughout the region getting customers back online.  We will remain working to get everyone back online as soon as we are able.
Our technicians have restored services to most customers, but some outages remain throughout the Fraser Valley.  As conditions allow, our technicians will continue working to restore all customers.
We will continue to monitor the situation and provide updates when available.
44000.summary: Due to extreme weather and driving conditions in British Columbia, some customers are temporarily without service. Once weather conditions in the affected areas subside, our local technicians will work to restore services as quickly as possible. Please note there will be delays in technician visits and equipment shipping. Our thoughts go out to all those impacted by the extreme weather and we greatly appreciate your patience during this time.
